intro: Callicarpa brevipetiolata, commonly known as the short-stemmed beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to East Asia. It is characterized by its clusters of small, violet-blue berries that appear in the fall. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and a smooth, dark green upper surface. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and prefers well-drained soil. The berries are not only ornamental but also attract birds and other wildlife.
